alert.note: Alert for Comanche; Kiowa (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 04 at 1:03PM CST until March 05 at 7:00PM CST by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE RISK EXPECTED SUNDAY... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 7 PM CST SUNDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 080 AND 089... The National Weather Service in Dodge City has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon to 7 PM CST Sunday. * AFFECTED AREA...In Kansas, Fire Weather Zone 080 Kiowa and Fire Weather Zone 089 Comanche. * WINDS...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 13 percent. * IMPACTS...Any ignitions will have the potential to burn out of control rapidly. Given the background drought conditions and very dry and dormant fuels, any outdoor burning, or any activities involving sparks or flames, are strongly discouraged Sunday afternoon.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
